info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 9:02AM CDT until July 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
North Fabius River near Ewing.
River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...North Fabius River near Ewing.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Wednesday night.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Left bank begins to flood near Monticello.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/lsx

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
